intro: Trillium rectistamineum, commonly known as the straight-stemmed trillium, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its three leaves and three petals. The plant typically blooms in early spring with white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodlands and shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is a subject of conservation efforts in its native range.
